pageContext.claim: “They're sending up to dogs. You see that? Dog's got ballots, everybody's getting ballots, probably everybody, but Republicans are going to get the ballots, right?”
pageContext.analysis: Trump finds a problem where there is none. Dogs and other pets sometimes are sent voter registration forms (not ballots) by third-party groups dedicated to registering people to vote, which access commercial mailing lists. That's because sometimes pet owners had signed up for subscriptions in their pet’s name. None of this is indicative of voter fraud, and that it’s not a crime unless people actually try to register their pets by mailing in the form to elections officials.
